intro: Argostemma lobulatum var. lobulatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf argostemma, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves with a narrow, lance-shaped form. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals and a prominent yellow stamen. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
